867814198717235200.text: Are all #crypto-lawyers this outspoken on panels? Enjoying the back and forth! @emschanning @msantoriESQ @Th_Linder_MME #TokenSummit

867812892854202368.text: .@valkenburgh : good job moderating a fast moving panel #TokenSummit !

867812425642385408.text: "Some ppl assume that #Switzerland is a #regulatory/tax haven and paradise. They do have rules, and enforcement"- @Th_Linder_MME #blockchain

867809450706452480.text: Quotable: "there are no grey areas in law - they are *developing* areas." - @msantoriESQ #TokenSummit @CooleyLLP #blockchain #ico

867808729030316032.text: Threshold: "Transferring ownership units of an already built golf course is certainly not a #securities offering"-@valkenburgh #TokenSummit

867807507229532160.text: "A NPO foundation that doesn't give rights to future profits is not #equity. It's closer to #kickstarter" -@Th_Linder_MME #TokenSummit

867806108177489920.text: Compliance panel discussions different legal structures / models for @ethereumproject , @zcashco, and others. #blockchain #tokenSummit #icopic.twitter.com/0P6HGDJoIa

867801121313521664.text: Venture cap is all about milestone investment and the team. More structure is anticipated in #ICO structure in coming 6-9mo. #TokenSummit

867799799277379585.text: Did the waning of interest from traditional generalist VCs lead to the (often irrational) ICO rush? #TokenSummit

867799284690714628.text: A lot of talk about "technical due diligence" on ICOs at the #TokenSummit. For the avg person this will be entirely opaque. #blockchain

867798309351469057.text: "So, we're doing this outside the US"- @wwwMZ re:establishing Iconomi. Relevance of this? Jurisdictional #arbitrage is a thing #TokenSummit

867391528850903045.text: Full room for the discussion on #academia / #industry partnerships to research #blockchain at #consensus2017pic.twitter.com/uwnZGQebB4

867386532679823360.text: Astute comment from the #academic  workshop at #Consensus17 by @el33th4xor . We couldn't agree morehttps://twitter.com/ilianaov/status/867386018437242883 …

867383133842399232.text: We're going to have a lot of fundamental challenges to solve and have a lot of fun as a community in this process

867382875380908033.text: "If you have replicated validators as part of your system - it's important that they fail independently." -@el33th4xor #Consensus17

867382367618568194.text: Moderator: "Are we in a real danger of a major hack on any of these core blockchain systems? What's the impact?" #consensus17

867381894064877568.text: Agreed, we hear this all the time!! "Some ppl are tasked by their CEO to go find and implement a #blockchain." -@el33th4xor #consensus17

867381476181950464.text: "All of these domains have their own specific requirements" @el33th4xor quorum Consensus systems v. @zcashco consensus, etc, all depends!

867381084396429313.text: Formal analysis of these protocols / thesis analysis is a tough job. Especially when ideas don't come out from the lab #Consensus2017

867380736973787136.text: Good point "1st formal analysis of #bitcoin came at the end of 2015." - @FBaldimtsi industry doesn't wait #Consensus2017

867380307342893056.text: "We need frameworks to assess/evaluate claims. The level of academic rigour is one of the only ways we could operate" -@FBaldimtsi yes!

867380009371152384.text: "A lot of people coming out with tech solutions have a vested stake in saying their solution is the best." - #SarahMeiklejohn from UCL

867379291398565888.text: "People are building systems by gut feel. There are guzzilion parameters"- @el33th4xor "lack of scientific inquiry" - #consensus17 agree!

867376948162514948.text: "Universities do more than teach. It's about a community and relationships for rest of student's lives" -@camharvey #Consensus17

867376708424540160.text: "Academia and publishing is in a bubble. Employers will look at github contributions and MOOCs, not just university degrees" - @PeterRizun

867376192411840513.text: Provocative question: "Will decentralization affect academia and publishing? Or is it insular?" -#Consensus17 academic workshop panel

867375506076971008.text: "Higher education needs to evolve. Industry partnerships may be the best way to get there" - @neha . We at @ColliderX agree! #consensus17

867374131700002817.text: "If industry wants a supply of candidates, they need to work on getting profs interested in teaching topics" - @camharvey #consensus17

867137325918285824.text: Great news, @nucoFuture ! Looking forward to collaborating with your team on research topics!https://twitter.com/nucofuture/status/867135325889597440 …

867023121764810753.text: Wow. "There's no way of predicting the innovation potential of combining IOT, AI, and blockchain" -@Fidelity That's our @ColliderX vision!

867022060610080770.text: I'm sensing a trend here at #consensus17: we keep forgetting about the humans. We need the systems to be more useful, not just tech superior

867021617477689344.text: Challenges: 1. Tech: Trade-off between scalability, privacy, and achieving p2p settlement. 2. Policy 3. Control - there's no formal Mngmt

867021076383100929.text: Fascinating consumer behaviour insights from the user experience studies done at @Fidelity . Usability from a consumer perspective is key

867020712791478278.text: Others treated it like an activation code: use once and discard?

867020460059484161.text: Most people did the first. Comparing recovery phrase like a password. Some ppl expected a "forgot my password" button. Bad mental model

867020257612976128.text: Reaction- ppl tried to compare it to something they knew. Other ppl tries to develop new mental model. Or ppl ran away

867020063597096961.text: User behaviour with bitcoin wallets: a. Gave local wallets and private keys. Result : people were perplexed. There was no mental model.

867019816967778304.text: Awesome! @Fidelity now allows employees to see their @coinbase holdings next to their other assets. Soon to roll out to all clients!

867018889632374784.text: Yes, #blockchain is becoming mainstream. CEO of @Fidelity Abby Johnson keynote @ #consensus17 re: not thinking through lens of the currentpic.twitter.com/PKGH28dSXE

867016932733616128.text: Good point from @ErikVoorhees: media loves to portray bad news because it's newsworthy. But anyone who's used bitcoin gets it. #consensus17

867016435637288961.text: Most clients don't use bitcoin because of the reputation. So long as it's a useful product, it will be just fine -@OneMorePeter #consensus17
